LAW500F.name: Criminal Law
LAW500F.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LAW500F.description: A study of the Criminal Justice System with an emphasis on defense counsel & prosecutor, adversary systems, ethics, criminal statutes, inchoate crimes & defenses.
LAW500F.restrictions: Open to students in the MSU College of Law.

LAW500G.name: Property
LAW500G.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LAW500G.description: A survey of fundamental property law. The topics covered included possessory interests real and personal, findings, bailments, and adverse possession.
LAW500G.restrictions: Open to students in the MSU College of Law.

LAW500M.name: Business Enterprises
LAW500M.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LAW500M.description: This course focuses on agency, partnership, & closely-held corporations.
LAW500M.restrictions: Open to students in the MSU College of Law.

LAW500N.name: Constitutional Law II
LAW500N.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LAW500N.description: A study of procedure & substantive due process, equal protection, Bill of Rights, & Freedom of Expression.
LAW500N.restrictions: Open to students in the MSU College of Law.

LAW500P.name: Evidence
LAW500P.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LAW500P.description: Study of the principles of evidence under the Anglo-American system of jurisprudence.
LAW500P.restrictions: Open to Law students or master's of law students or law lifelong students or law non degree students.

LAW500Q.name: Professional Responsibility
LAW500Q.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LAW500Q.description: This course explores the obligations owed by the lawyer, both individually, and as a member of the legal profession.
LAW500Q.restrictions: Open to students in the MSU College of Law.

LAW500R.name: Torts I
LAW500R.description: This course examines the protection the law affords against interference by others with one's person, property, or intanglible interest
LAW500R.restrictions: Open to students in the MSU College of Law.

LAW500U.name: Topics in Professional Responsibility
LAW500U.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LAW500U.restrictions: Open to Law students or master's of law students or law lifelong students or law non degree students in the MSU College of Law.

LAW501A.name: Basic Income Tax A
LAW501A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LAW501A.description: Basic concepts of federal income taxation.
LAW501A.restrictions: Open to students in the MSU College of Law.

LAW501B.name: Basic Income Tax B
LAW501B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LAW501B.description: An in-depth examination of technical federal income tax issues, including a focus on solving complex tax problems.
LAW501B.restrictions: Open to Law students or master's of law students or law lifelong students or law non degree students in the MSU College of Law.

LAW501D.name: Trusts and Estates
LAW501D.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LAW501D.description: A survey of practices for transmitting wealth in view of death.
LAW501D.restrictions: Open to Law students or master of laws students or law lifelong students or law non-degree students in the MSU College of Law.

LAW501E.name: Secured Transactions
LAW501E.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LAW501E.description: Process of financing the sale of goods. Article 9 of the Uniform Commercial Code - Secured Transactions focus.

LAW501F.name: Sales and Leases

LAW501F.description: Formation and terms, as well as breach, of contracts for sales of goods under Article 2 of the Uniform Commercial Code. Examines Article 2a's provision on leases. Comparisons between Article 2 of the Uniform Commercial Code and the United Nations Convention on the International Sale of Goods.
LAW501F.restrictions: Open to Law students or law advanced students or law lifelong students or law non-degree students.

LAW501G.name: Payment Systems
LAW501G.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year

LAW501G.restrictions: Open to Law students or law advanced students or law lifelong students or law non-degree students.

LAW501J.name: Secured Transactions and Practice
LAW501J.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LAW501J.description: Examination of the intricacies of a secured transaction under the Revised Article 9 of the Uniform Commercial Code.
LAW501J.restrictions: Open to Law students or master's of law students or law lifelong students or law non degree students.

LAW501K.name: Basic Income Taxation
LAW501K.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LAW501K.description: Examination of technical federal income tax issues, including a focus on solving complex tax problems.
LAW501K.restrictions: Open to Law students or master's of law students or law lifelong students or law non degree students.

LAW501M.name: Commercial Transactions Survey

LAW501M.restrictions: Open to Law students or master of laws students or law lifelong students or law non-degree students.

LAW502.name: Accounting for Lawyers

LAW505B.name: Arbitration-Labor

Collective bargaining agreements, whether an issue is subject to arbitration, timelines for filing an arbitration, the burden of proof, quantum of proof, the concept of discipline and just cause, as well as contract interpretation. Participation in mock trials and drafting an arbitration opinion.

LAW505C.name: Problem-Solving Approaches to Conflict Resolution

LAW508M.name: Corporate Law Colloquium
